sections.heading: Time limit.Section 624A.2 - Cause of action or defense — necessity.Section 624A.3 - Injunction.
sections.text:
624A.1 Time limit.

Such proceedings must be commenced within one year after the judgment or order was made, unless the party entitled thereto is a minor or person of unsound mind, and then withinone year after the removal of such disability. [R60, §3501; C73, §3157; C97, §4094; C24, 27, 31, 35, 39, §

12793;

C46, 50, 54, 58, 62, 66, 71, 73, 75, 77, 79, 81, §683.1] C93, §624A.1 Sat Dec 23 11:20:41 2023 Iowa Code 2024, Section 624A.1 (15, 0)

sections.heading: Cause of action or defense — necessity.
sections.text:
624A.2 Cause of action or defense — necessity.

The judgment shall not be vacated on motion or petition until it is adjudged there is a cause of action or defense to the action in which the judgment is rendered. [R60, §3503; C73, §3159; C97, §4096; C24, 27, 31, 35, 39, §

12796;

C46, 50, 54, 58, 62, 66, 71, 73, 75, 77, 79, 81, §683.2] C93, §624A.2 Sat Dec 23 11:20:41 2023 Iowa Code 2024, Section 624A.2 (16, 0)

sections.heading: Injunction.
sections.text:
624A.3 Injunction.

The party seeking to vacate or modify a judgment or order may have an injunction suspending proceedings on the whole or part thereof, which shall be granted by the courtupon its being rendered probable, by affidavit or verified petition, or by exhibition of therecord, that the party is entitled to the relief asked. [R60, §3505; C73, §3161; C97, §4098; C24, 27, 31, 35, 39, §

12799;

C46, 50, 54, 58, 62, 66, 71, 73, 75, 77, 79, 81, §683.3] C93, §624A.3 Sat Dec 23 11:20:42 2023 Iowa Code 2024, Section 624A.3 (16, 0)
